selectionEntryGroups.name: Regiment

modifiers.value: Non-flyer Vehicles can not be taken in the Airborne Company
Cavalry can not be taken in the Airborne Company

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Airborne Company)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Airborne Company) gains the following rule:
- Coordinated Drop: As long as a unit with the Imperial Guard (Airborne Company) is already on the table at the start of the turn, any models that are attempting to Deep Strike within 6" of that model do not scatter, nor can they become disrupted. In addition to this, any unit that has the Deep Strike special rule, that attempts a Grav-Chute insertion from a Valkyrie or Vendetta may rerolll the scatter dice.
- All units that have access to a Chimera as a Dedicated Transport may instead take a Valkyrie Assault Carrier.
- In Addition to this, All Infantry units that do not already have access to the Deep Strike, Infiltrate or a Dedicated Transport with the Flyer unit type, must be upgraded to have Grav-Chutes for +10 points per squad, or +50 points for a platoon, no matter the amount of squads, which in turn gives them the Deep Strike Special Rule. Scout Sentinels may also be upgraded in this way for +15 points per model.
- Due to the highly specific nature of this formation no units with the Vehicle type may be taken unless they also have the Flyer Sub-Type, nor may any units with the Cavalry Sub-Type be taken.
- The Following Units may be taken with no Restricitons:
- 1-3 Heavy Weapon Squads may be taken without a parent Platoon as a single Heavy Support choice, but lose the Line Sub-Type.
- 1-3 Special Weapon Squads may be taken without a parent Platoon as a single Elites choice, but lose the Line Sub-Type.
- The following units may not be taken in an Airborne Company: Ogryn Squads, Ratling Squads, Conscript Squads, Penal Legion Squads, Chimera Armoured Transports, Rough Rider Squadrons, Armoured Sentinel Squadrons, Hellhound Flame Tanks, Leman Russ Battle Tanks, Self-Propelled Support Battery, Mantiocre Rocket Launcher, Any Lords of War.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Armoured Company)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Armoured Company) special rule gains the following benefits.
- Crush Them! Any Ramming Attacks Strength is increased by +1 in addition to any other modifiers they receive.
- If detachment has Imperial Guard (Armoured Company) Special Rule, then the following unit types must be selected as Compulsory Troop Choices and gain the Line unit Sub-Type: Leman Russ Battle Tanks Squadrons (Consisting of a Single Tank)
- In Addition to this, All Infantry units that may take a Chimera as a Dedicated Transport, must. If any Infantry Unit cannot start the game deployed in a vehicle of some kind, it may not be a part of a Detachment with the Imperial Guard (Armoured Company) Special Rule.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Cavalry Squadron)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Cavalry Squadron) special rule gains the following benefits.
- Thundering Charge: Any model with Cavalry Unit Type may re-roll any charge rolls and gains Rage (2) special rule.
- If detachment has Imperial Guard (Cavalry Squadron) Special Rule, then the following unit types must be selected as Compulsory Troop Choices and gain the Line unit Sub-Type: Rough Rider Squadrons.
- In addition, the following units become a a 0-1 Option: Storm Troopers, Ogryns, Ratlings, Valkyrie Carrier Squadrons and only 1 Heavy Support Choice may be chosen.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Infantry Company)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Infantry Company) special rule gains the following benefits.
- Stand Your Ground!: Any unit with this special rule may make a free Overwatch Reaction when declared a target of a charge, but all shots will be made as Snap Shots. This special Stand Your Grown Overwatch attack does not use up any of your reaction allotment in the Assault Phase, but each unit may still only react once per phase.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Penal Battalion)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Penal Battalion) special rule gains the following benefits.
- Harsh Overseers: Any model with the Infantry or Cavalry Type may re-roll failed leadership tests.
- If detachment has Imperial Guard (Penal Battalions) Special Rule, then the following units must be selected as Compulsory Troop Choices and gain the Line unit Sub-Type (any combination is allowed): Penal Legion Squad, Conscript Squad (Does not need ‘Parent’ Infantry Platoon).
- Any Penal Legion or Conscript Squads may take the following upgrade for +15 points a unit: 
- Send in the next wave!: If a unit with the special rule is removed off of the table for any reason (Sweeping Advance, Killed to a man, retreats off the board etc), roll a D6, on a 4+ an exact copy of that unit that was just removed is placed into ongoing reserves and may attempt to enter the battlefield at the beginning of its owners next player turn. Any 'new' units that are created from the Send in the Next Wave rule do not count in anyway for victory point purposes.
- In addition, the following unit choices gain the following limitations 0-1 Veteran Squad, 0-1 Infantry Platoon, 0-0 Storm Troopers and only 1 Heavy Support Choice may be chosen.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Scout Regiment)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Scout Regiment) special rule gains the following benefits.
- Target their Officers: Any to hit roll of a 6 with a Lasgun gains the Precision Shot Special Rule. In addition to this, any unit consisting wholly of Infantry models gains the Skirmish unit sub-type.
- Any unit with the Infantry Type may also purchase the Scout and/or Infiltrators special rule for +10 Points per rule, per unit.
- In additon 0-3 Special Weapon Squads, upgraded only with Sniper Rifles, may be taken as a Single Elites Choice. The Guardsmen in these squads gain +1 BS.
- If the detachment has Imperial Guard (Scout Company) Special Rule, then the following choices instead become a 0-1 Option: Storm Troopers, Ogryns, Hellhound Flametank and only 1 Heavy Support Choice may be chosen.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (Storm Troopers Regiment)
rules.description:
Any Model with the Imperial Guard (Storm Troopers Regiment) special rule gains the following benefits.
- Schola Progenium Precision: Any model with the Infantry or Cavalry Type may re-roll 1’s to hit while making a shooting attack.
- If detachment has Imperial Guard (Storm Trooper Regiment) Special Rule, then the following unit types must be selected as Compulsory Troop Choices and gain the Line unit Sub-Type: Storm Troopers.

rules.name: Imperial Guard (X)
rules.description: Much Like the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule, to allow some variation within Guard Armies, listed following are some differing guard formations which should allow people to at least closely resemble some of the Guard Regiments caught up in the Badab War. When creating an army, select one of the following Types of Imperial Guard (X) rule and apply it to your army while building it.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Scout and Infiltrate
Must take one of the following

rules.name: Senior Officer
rules.description:
The Company Commandder can issue up to two orders each turn. He has a command radius of 12”. Company Commanders can use any of the following orders:
- First Rank Fire! Second Rank Fire!
- Incoming!
- Move! Move! Move!
- Bring It Down!
- Fire on My Target!
- Get Back in the Fight!

infoLinks.name: First Rank Fire! Second Rank Fire!

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A unit with Camo Cloaks gains the Skirmish Sub-type.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Regimental Advisor

rules.name: Artillery Bombardment
rules.description: This is treated as a shooting attack made by the Master of Ordnance but may target a separate target to the rest of the Company Command Squad, with the Bombardment weapon profile.

characteristics.name: Range
characteristics.$text: Unlimited

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.$text: Ordnance 1

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Large Blast (5"), Shred, Pinning, (In)accurate

rules.name: (In)accurate
rules.description: If a ‘hit’ is rolled, the template still scatters 2D6" In the direction of the small arrow. If an arrow is rolled, the template scatters an additional D6". If the target is in Line of Sight of the Master of Ordnance you may reduce the scatter by his Ballistic Skill as per usual.

rules.name: Telepathic Relay
rules.description: Whilst the Astropath is alive, you add 1 to any of your reserve rolls for units within this detachment.

rules.name: Intercept Reserves
rules.description: Whilst the Officer of the Fleet is alive your opponent must subtract 1 from all reserve rolls.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take on of the following

rules.name: Summary Execution
rules.description:
If the Commissars’ unit fails a Morale test of any kind, the Commissar will summarily execute the squad’s current commander. This is the model in the squad with the Highest Leadership Value (excluding the Commissar himself). If there are one or more models with the same leadership, randomly determine which is eligible foe execution.
The executed model is immediately removed as a casualty and may not take any Saves or Damage Mitigation rolls of any kind.
The unit in question must then re-roll the failed Morale check ~ if this test also fails, then the squad falls back as normal.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take on of the following

rules.name: Righteous Fury
rules.description: The Priest and his attached unit gains the Hatred (Everything!) Special Rule. Note this doesn’t effect for Ogryns who are confused by the Priests rhetoric, or Ratlings who are far too concerned with their own survival.

rules.name: Attached Deployment
rules.description: Each model with the Attached Deployment special rule must be attached to a unit during deployment. They may only join a unit with the Infantry type, but may never leave said unit and if their parent unit is destroyed, they are also removed from play. In addition to this, they gain whatever sub-types and special rules their parent unit has. Finally, while a single unit can have multiple Attached Specialists, only one of each type may be attached to a squad. E. G. a squad could have both a Commissar, Enginseer and Priest but could not have three Enginseers.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take one of the following

entryLinks.name: Ripper Gun and Close Combat Weapon

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take one of the following

entryLinks.name: Ripper Gun and Close Combat Weapon

rules.name: Hidden and Safe
rules.description:
While the majority of the unit is in some form of non-dangerous terrain, they receive +3 Leadership and increase their cover save by +1 (for a total of +2 for a skirmish unit).


If the unit is ever required to fallback, they fallback 3D6 inches instead of the usual 2D6.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take up to three of the following
May take one of the following
Must take one of the following
Up to two in unit

rules.name: Special Operations
rules.description:
Before Deployment, declare to your opponent which mission each Storm Trooper Squad in your army is following.
- Reconnaissance: The reconnaissance mission grants the Scouts and Move Through Cover Special Rule.
- Airborne Assault: The airborne assault mission allows the Storm Troopers squad to re-roll the scatter dice when they Deep Strike or use Grav-Chute Insertion. Also any Storm Trooper Squads can suffer from a Disordered Deep Strike.
- Behind Enemy Lines: The behind enemy lines mission grants the squad the Infiltrate special rule and it also confers their weapons the Pinning and Shell Shock (2) Special Rules the first time the unit fires for any reason (even as a reaction).

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take one of the following

rules.name: Junior Officer
rules.description:
The Platoon Commander has a command radius of 6” and can issue any one of the following orders once per turn:
- First Rank Fire! Second Rank Fire!
- Incoming!
- Move! Move! Move!
as listed under the Company Command Squad Entry.

infoLinks.name: First Rank Fire! Second Rank Fire!

rules.name: Forward Sentries
rules.description: The unit gains the Infiltrate and Move Through Cover Special Rules, as well as Shroud Bombs.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The unit is Immune to Pinning. If the unit rolls a double 5 or double 6 on any leadership check, every model with a Discipline Collar is immediately removed from play.

rules.name: Grav-chute Insertion
rules.description:
A unit may disembark from a model with this special rule even if it moved more than half of its movement allowance or is a Zooming flyer.


If a unit disembarks, nominate any point over which the Valkyrie/Vendetta moved over and deploy the squad in concentric circles, then roll a scatter dice and D6 (or 2D6 if the Valkyrie/Vendetta is Zooming). If the unit scatters, every model must immediately take a dangerous terrain test. If any of the models cannot be deployed, the entire unit is destroyed. (Note Nuncio Vox’s or similar abilities to not help/effect this roll).

rules.name: Dispersed Deployment
rules.description: While chosen as a squadron for the purposes of army selection, each Valkyrie/Vendetta is treated as a separate unit during the game rather than as part of a vehicle squadron and may deploy and operate independently of each other.

rules.name: Clos-in Support
rules.description: A Vulture (ignoring the normal rules for Flyers) may start on the board in Hover Mode if the controlling player choses, but if chosen, it may not swap to Zooming Mode until turn 2.

rules.name: Fighting Platforms
rules.description: Up to 20 Infantry models may fire from the open deck of the Stormlord in the Controlling players Shooting Phase. The do not count as moving (as long as the Stormlord moved no more than 5” in the proceeding movement phase). They may use any part of the Stormlords hull to draw range and line of site from.

rules.name: Support Detachment
rules.description: While all the models in this unit are purchased as a single Lord of War choice, they may be deployed individually on the battlefield and do not need to follow the rules for a vehicle squadron.

rules.name: Aerial Weapon Platforms
rules.description: A Lumbering model with this special rule may fire all of its weapons in the shooting phase as if it was a Super-Heavy Vehicle. In addition to this, it may (contrary to the rulebook) make a Return Fire action with any turret mounted weapons against any model with the Flyer Sub-Type that fired at it.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
A unit with a Command Vox may use the highest Leadership available to any unit equipped with either a Command Vox, Vox-Caster or Nuncio-Vox in the Detachment.
In addition, any scatter dice may be rerolled if they are in line of site of the bearer.
In Regards to Imperial Guard forces, if an Order is given through a Command-Vox to a squad with a Command-Vox or Vox- Caster, it may re-roll Failed Order Rolls.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
A unit with a Vox-Caster may use the highest Leadership of a unit that contains a Command Vox or Nuncio-Vox in the detachment.
In addition, any scatter dice may be rerolled if they are in line of site of the bearer. In Regards to Imperial Guard forces, if an Order is given through a Command-Vox to a squad with a Vox-Caster, it may re-roll Failed Order Rolls.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While the bearer is still alive, his squad counts as scoring one additional wound for the purposes of calculating close combat results. In addition any friendly units within 12" with the Imperial Guard (X) Special Rule may re-roll failed Morale and Pinning tests.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While the standard bearer is alive, any combat within 6" counts as having scored an additional wound for the purposes of calculating close combat results.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If any model in a unit contains a medi-pack, the whole unit gains the Feel No Pain (5+) Special Rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a flak armour gains a 5+ Save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a carapace armour gains a 4+ Save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A vehicle with an Armoured Cockpit on counts all Crew Stunned Results as Crew Shaken instead.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A vehicle with Chaff Launchers gets a 5+ Invulnerable Save against any Missile or Rocket like weapons.

rules.name: Send in the next wave!
rules.description: If a unit with the special rule is removed off of the table for any reason (Sweeping Advance, Killed to a man, retreats off the board etc), roll a D6, on a 4+ an exact copy of that unit that was just removed is placed into ongoing reserves and may attempt to enter the battlefield at the beginning of its owners next player turn. Any 'new' units that are created from the Send in the Next Wave rule do not count in anyway for victory point purposes.

sharedRules.name: Orders
sharedRules.description:
A number of models in the Imperial Guard Army have the ability to issue one or more orders each turn. These models are called officers.

Orders must be issued at the start of the Shooting phase before any other nonorder based shooting is declared. An officer may attempt to issue orders provided that he is not locked in assault, embarked in a transport or falling back. Orders must be issued before the Officer and his unit shoot.

To Issue an order the Officer must declare which order he is attempting to use and select a single friendly non-vehicle unit within his command radius to carry out the order. This may be the officers own squad if you wish. The chosen unit must take a leadership check to act upon the order. Orders cannot be issued to squads that embarked on a transport or units that have already made a shooting attack or have already received an order (even if failed). Unless otherwise stated orders cannot be issued to units that are falling back or that are pinned.

Orders Received, Sir!: If the test is passed, the officer’s men leap to obey without hesitation – the squad immediately carries out the order and may not act further during the Shooting Phase. Once the order has been completed, the officer can attempt to issue another order (if he is eligible to do so). When the officer has finished issuing orders, he and his Command Squad can shoot as normal if the player wishes.

Could You Repeat That, Sir?: If the test is failed, there has been a breakdown of the communications. The order does not take effect, although both the officer’s squad and the ordered squad may otherwise act normally in the Shooting Phase.

Incompetent Command: If a double 6 is rolled for the order, confusion reigns. Not only does this order not take effect, as described above, but no further orders can be issues (by any officer) this Shooting Phase.

Inspired Tactics: If a double 1 is rolled for the order, the officer has enforced his will in record time. Once the order has been completed, the officer can immediately issue a further order (there is no need to make a test). This additional order is ‘free’ and does not count towards the number of orders the officer can issue in a turn.

sharedRules.name: Combined Squads
sharedRules.description:
Infantry Squads (not other infantry units such as Conscripts, Heavy Weapons Teams, Veterans etc) that are from a single Infantry Platoon have the option of forming Combined Squads. The decision to form combined squads must be made at deployment.

If the Imperial Guard player wishes to deploy his forces in this way then any Infantry Squad may join another Infantry Squad from the same platoon.

If you decide to form any squads into larger units, then they are of course treated as a single unit from that point. Combined Squads may not split up into their constituent components units again during the game.

Note: Due to how Dedicated transports work in this edition, you will not be able to deploy any dedicated transports for any Infantry Squads that have deployed as Combined Squads. Just be aware when list building.

sharedRules.name: Platoon Formation
sharedRules.description:
An Infantry Platoon uses up a single Troops Choice on the Force Organisation Chart. Each Infantry Platoon can consist of the following units coming up on the following pages.
1 Platoon Command Squad, 2-5 Infantry Squads, 0-5 Heavy Weapon Squads*, 0-2 Special Weapons Squads, 0-1 Conscript Squads.
*May not have more Heavy Weapon Squads than Infantry Squads.

sharedRules.name: Amphibious
sharedRules.description: A Chimera treats all water features as clear terrain when it moves.

sharedRules.name: Localised Fleet Strikes
sharedRules.description: While chosen as a squadron for the purposes of army selection, each Vehicle is treated as a separate unit during the game rather than as part of a vehicle squadron and may deploy and operate independently of each other.

sharedProfiles.name: First Rank Fire! Second Rank Fire!

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If the order is successfully issued, and the ordered unit has not moved in its proceeding movement phase (or regrouped) it immediately shoots at any visible target. When it fires, each lasgun fires an additional shot (Total 3 up to 12", total 2 shots 12"- 24").

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If the order is successfully issued the unit may make a Run move of 6"+D6", but may not shoot or assault for the remainder of this player turn.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: f the order is successfully issued, the ordered unit receives +2 to its cover save but may only make snap shots until the start of its following movement phase. If the unit moves for any reason it loses the benefit of this order.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: This order can only be issued a unit that is falling back. If the order is successfully issued, the ordered unit immediately regroups regardless of enemy proximity etc. As a result, the ordered squad may shoot and assault as normal this turn (but still counts as having moved).

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If the order was successfully issues, choose one enemy unit visible to the officer. The ordered unit immediately shoots at the nominated target. Successful cover saves and Shrouded saves taken against this shooting attack must be rerolled.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If the order is successfully issued, choose one enemy Vehicle, Monstrous Creature, Dreadnought (or anything logically this size and squadrons or squads of these also) visible to the officer. The ordered unit immediately shoots at the nominated target, counting their weapons as twin-linked.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: As long as a model with Camo netting hasn’t moved this game turn for any reason, it gets +2 to any Cover Save it currently has.
